issues.description: The problem statement requires ExcellenceLand to have a private attribute 'rides' of type List<Ride> and asks for public getters for all attributes. In the solution, the field 'rides' is declared as List<Ride> but the public getter getRides() returns a Set<Ride> (new HashSet<>(rides)). This mismatches the declared attribute type and the problem specification and will confuse students about the expected getter signature and return type (and may cause tests that expect a List<Ride> to fail).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the getter consistent with the declared attribute type and the problem statement. Change the getter signature to return List<Ride> (e.g., public List<Ride> getRides()) and return either the internal list or an immutable/copy view (for example, return new ArrayList<>(rides) or Collections.unmodifiableList(rides)) so the returned type matches the specified List<Ride>.
